intro: Acoridium tenuibulbum, commonly known as the narrow-capsule acoridium, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants such as philodendrons and peace lilies. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a spadix surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe, a common feature in the Araceae family. Acoridium tenuibulbum is typically found in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories.
